reviews.text: The Michelangelo Hotel is our first choice when arriving or leaving Italy from Malpensa Airport. Easy bus ride to center of Milan, train station and the Michelangelo Hotel. A stones throw from the train station the Michelangelo Hotel is very clean with nice bathrooms and the beds are comfortable! The continental breakfast very good, fresh oj and coffie! Ok price
reviews.title: Close to train station

reviews.text: I choose this hotel because it close to the milan Central train station and the metro the hotel is nice in Everything .
reviews.title: I like it

reviews.text: The room is big for 3 bed and its clean and the bath alsoe clean and good breakfast.
reviews.title: Nice Surprise

reviews.text: I am surprised that the TV from the time of the eighties and they have SKY cabel and it not work in Hd channel because TV old.
reviews.title: Bland but comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located bang opposite the Central Train Station, Michelangelo is a great business hotel. The breakfast spread is remarkable with fresh orange juice - made by an interesting looking contraption, frothy cappucino, fresh strawberries, figs, cheeses and cottage cheese pie is a welcome change from the usual cold breads and cereals. The other surprise is the Free mini bar - yes only non alchoholic stuff but still great for the weary traveller. The best surprise is your own jacuzzi in the bathroom with powerful jets!
reviews.title: Comfortable and travel convenient

reviews.text: We stayed at the Michelangelo and could not have asked for a more perfect hotel. The convenience of the trains and metro directly across the street made the Michelangelo even more inviting. While in Milan the weather was unseasonably warm so the AC was welcomed. The breakfast buffet was the best I have ever experienced in Europe--too much to choose from. For the price and location you can't go wrong. I would certainly return to Michelangelo on my next visit to Milan.
reviews.title: Perfect location and service

reviews.text: We've stayed at the Michelangelo twice and had good experiences both times. The hotel is directly across the street from the main train station (Milano Centrale): exit the station on the left as you walk away from the platforms and you'll see the hotel behind the cab stand.
reviews.title: Closest (Nice) Train Station Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are fine, if a little outdated. But if you have luggage and are coming into Milan by train, the location is ideal.
reviews.title: Ideal location

reviews.text: Arriving at the central station in Milano after 22.30, we were too late to get a train to Geneve, so were forced to find a hotel in which to spend the night. The Michelangelo was the second hotel we tried, and while the 240 euro price tag seemed rather a lot for a nine hour stay, we were too tired to search for another hotel that had rooms available.
reviews.title: Convenient and Comfortable

reviews.text: Our bedroom and bathroom were very nice indeed, spacious, tastefully decorated, mostly hi-tech and obviously recently renovated. Everywhere was spotlessly clean. In the bedroom there was lots of wardrobe space and plenty of hangers, the bed was very comfortable even if the pillows were rather hard, and there was plenty of room for a sitting area and desk. The bathroom had double sinks, and a large whirlpool bath.
reviews.title: Great Hotel & amazing location

reviews.text: Just like everybody said if you are using trains to get around europe this is a great place to stay. We stayed for one night and I was pretty impressed. Stacks of restaraunts, robes and slippers, electric closing blinds, spa bath and great views. Maybee we jagged a great room but for a hotel close to a train station it was not to bad at all. The breakfast was ok and we had free WiFi in our room for a one night stay it was more than comftorble.
reviews.title: Location
Nice stay
reviews.text: We have stayed just for a weekend. Hotel has a good location just next to the main railway station and underground station, it's quiet (anyway, we could hear load japanese tourist in the next room), we had a really nice breakfast. We had a corner room, which is slightly bigger then others.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They do have free wi-fi in the whole hotel now, but you have to ask front desk how to connect to access point, since there is no information in the room.
reviews.title: Great location - be careful organsing transport from concergie

reviews.text: We spent a late evening in the hotel bar, but the staff was inattentive, service was very poor even bar was almost empty.
reviews.title: Could be better

reviews.text: This hotel is virtually across the road from Milan Central station where you can catch the shuttle to the airport. It is well appointed hotel and our room was very quiet - the joys of double glazed windows. Free internet, clean, comfortable rooms which were reasonably spacious. Not in the best area near the station - a bit seedy but ok. An Asian all you can eat restaurant just down from the hotel is ripper value! I asked the mature age Concierge how much it would cost for a taxi to another hotel in Milan where we were meeting a tour group which was 7km away.He said he could organize a car for 110 euro. The taxi I ordered from reception cost 13 euro - beware!
reviews.title: A Clearly Mismanaged Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed in very good triple room with family. Lovely bathroom with jacuzzi bath - great for relaxing after a days sightseeing. Breakfast was good, plenty of variety and great fresh orange juice. Slight problem with noise from the street especially at weekend.
reviews.title: Very comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked very last minute, asked for as high up as possible and got 1st floor (it was last minute!) but this turned out to be better in that the room (114) was quite large (compared with one I did get to see on the 9th floor). No view but very comfortable.
reviews.title: Not your usual train station hotel

reviews.text: Helpful staff, nice restaurant and breakfast included (buffet style).
reviews.title: All In - Great Choice - Very Happy

reviews.text: Fabulous restaurant (Noblesse Oblige, see my other review) just 5 minutes away by foot.
reviews.title: Great location, nice room

reviews.text: All in all a very pleasant stay and would recommend.
reviews.title: Central spot in Milan
